title: Conditional Probability Formula
text: The conditional probability of A given B may be computed by means of the following formula: P(A$$\mid$$B)=P(A$$∩$$B)/P(B)

title: Sample Spaces
text: The sample space for this experiment is the set $$S=1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6$$ consisting of six equally likely outcomes. Let F denote the event “a five is rolled” and let O denote the event “an odd number is rolled,” so that $$F=5$$ and $$O=1, 3, 5$$

title: P(F$$∩$$O)
text: What is the probability of rolling a number in both set F AND set O?

subHints.title: P(F$$∩$$O)
subHints.text: $$5$$ is the only number in both F AND O. Rolling a $$5$$ is only $$1$$ possible outcome out of $$6$$. Therefore, probability of rolling a $$5$$ is $$\frac{1}{6}$$

title: P(F)
text: What is the probability of rolling a number in set F?

subHints.title: P(F)
subHints.text: Rolling a $$5$$ is only $$1$$ possible outcome out of $$6$$. Therefore, probability of rolling a number in set F is $$\frac{1}{6}$$

title: P(O$$\mid$$F)
text: Using the conditional probability formula, calculate P(O$$\mid$$F) using P(F$$∩$$O) and P(F)
